summary.title: ScheduleSync Threat Model
summary.description: A comprehensive threat model for the ScheduleSync project, including frontend, backend, database, Docker registry, CI/CD with GitHub Actions, and vulnerability scanning with Trivy.

threats.title: User Spoofing
threats.description: An attacker may attempt to impersonate the user to access their resources
threats.mitigation: Implement Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) and secure token-based sessions.

threats.title: Identity Spoofing
threats.description: Someone may impersonate a developer to make malicious code changes.
threats.mitigation: Implement MFA and controlled access to repositories.

threats.title: Code Tampering
threats.description: Malicious modification of code in the repository.
threats.mitigation: Use code reviews and controlled access policies.

threats.title: Workflow Privilege Escalation
threats.description: Unauthorized access to critical GitHub Actions workflows.
threats.mitigation: Use tokens with minimum permissions in workflows.

threats.title: IaC Tampering
threats.description: Modification of infrastructure code to deploy vulnerable configurations.
threats.mitigation: Use code reviews and access control in IaC repositories.

threats.title: Privilege Escalation in IaC
threats.description: Unauthorized access to infrastructure resources via Terraform.
threats.mitigation: Control permissions and conduct audits on Terraform.

threats.title: Information Disclosure
threats.description: Sensitive data leakage through services.
threats.mitigation: Encrypt data in transit and at rest; apply strict access control.

threats.title: Data Tampering
threats.description: An attacker could alter data between services if not encrypted.
threats.mitigation: Use TLS to encrypt communication between services.

threats.title: Denial of Service (DoS)
threats.description: These services could be overloaded to render them unusable.
threats.mitigation: Implement auto-scaling and rate limiting.

threats.title: Information Disclosure
threats.description: Sensitive data leakage through services.
threats.mitigation: Encrypt data in transit and at rest; apply strict access control.

threats.title: Data Tampering
threats.description: An attacker could alter data between services if not encrypted.
threats.mitigation: Use TLS to encrypt communication between services.

threats.title: Denial of Service (DoS)
threats.description: These services could be overloaded to render them unusable.
threats.mitigation: Implement auto-scaling and rate limiting.

threats.title: Traffic Tampering
threats.description: Without HTTPS, traffic between ALB and client could be intercepted or altered.
threats.mitigation: Implement HTTPS and TLS for all connections.

threats.title: Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS)
threats.description: ALB could be targeted by distributed denial of service attacks.
threats.mitigation: Enable DDoS protection services like AWS Shield.

threats.title: Privilege Escalation
threats.description: An attacker could attempt to exploit the ALB to access other services.
threats.mitigation: Restrict access through security policies and secure network configurations.

threats.title: Image Tampering
threats.description: Malicious code could be injected into Docker images.
threats.mitigation: Validate and scan images regularly.

threats.title: Information Disclosure
threats.description: Potential leakage of sensitive information within images.
threats.mitigation: Avoid storing secrets in images and use image scanning tools.

threats.title: Data Tampering
threats.description: An attacker could alter data if they gain access to the database
threats.mitigation: Enforce strict access control and use TLS.

threats.title: Information Disclosure
threats.description: Unauthorized access to sensitive data in DocumentDB.
threats.mitigation: Encrypt data and apply strict access policies.

threats.title: Denial of Service (DoS)
threats.description: Directed attacks to render the database unusable
threats.mitigation: Use scalable configurations and monitoring to detect traffic spikes.

threats.title: Information Disclosure
threats.description: Unauthorized access to files in S3 if misconfigured.
threats.mitigation: Ensure proper access policies and permissions.

threats.title: Data Tampering
threats.description: Possible alteration of files stored in S3.
threats.mitigation: Use access control and enable versioning in S3.

threats.title: Denial of Service (DoS)
threats.description: DoS attacks aimed at making files inaccessible.
threats.mitigation: Use AWS Shield and S3 scaling features.

threats.title: Secrets Disclosure
threats.description: Leakage of stored secrets and credentials.
threats.mitigation: Enforce strict access control and regularly rotate secrets.

threats.title: Secrets Tampering
threats.description: Possible modification of secrets by unauthorized users.
threats.mitigation: Use detailed access policies and regular auditing.

threats.title: User Spoofing
threats.description: Without HTTPS, traffic between ALB and client could be intercepted or altered.
threats.mitigation: Implement HTTPS and TLS for all connections.

threats.title: Information Disclosure
threats.description: ALB could be targeted by distributed denial of service attacks.
threats.mitigation: Enable DDoS protection services like AWS Shield.

threats.title: Denial of Service (DoS)
threats.description: An attacker could attempt to exploit the ALB to access other services.
threats.mitigation: Restrict access through security policies and secure network configurations.

threats.title: Code Tampering
threats.description: Malicious modification of code in the repository.
threats.mitigation: Use code reviews and controlled access policies.

threats.title: Code Tampering
threats.description: Malicious modification of code in the repository.
threats.mitigation: Use code reviews and controlled access policies.

threats.title: Log Repudiation
threats.description: Manipulation of logs to cover malicious activity.
threats.mitigation: Secure log storage and continuous auditing.

threats.title: Denial of Service (DoS)
threats.description: Overload CloudWatch to prevent attack detection.
threats.mitigation: Monitor CloudWatch usage and apply usage limits.

threats.title: Identity Spoofing
threats.description: Someone may impersonate a developer to make malicious code changes.
threats.mitigation: Implement MFA and controlled access to repositories.

threats.title: Code Tampering

threats.mitigation: Use code reviews and controlled access policies.
